website_summaries.verdict: Equipped with excellent design, materials, and technologies, the Fizik Aria R3 bike shoe is reported to administer an almost perfect link between the rider and his bike. The footwear’s stylish aesthetic, impeccable comfort, and flawless fit are its main selling points.Most have agreed that it is not cheap, but every penny is worth it due to its quality, performance, and positive traits.
pros: A majority of wearers applaud the Fizik Aria R3’s super comfortable feel, making it ideal for long rides
Many of the reviewers love the pair’s lightweight build
A lot of consumers find this road cycling shoe’s design to be good looking
The Aria R3’s uber stiff sole provides optimal power transfer, according to plenty of riders
A significant number of users appreciate this model’s closure system as it is efficient and easy to adjust
Several testers revel at the Fizik product’s excellent build quality
Some commenters accredit the no rubbing and no pressure fit of the shoe to its seamless upper design
A couple of shoppers love how there are plenty of color options to choose from
cons: Most of the complaints mention that this pair’s fairly high price may be an obstacle to some consumers
A few nitpicking comments say that the movement of the front ankle feels restricted at times due to the tongue

customer_reviews.title: Sexy, comfy and stiff
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, pretty boot. Took me 2 rides to figure out the fit. Love the Boa adjustability. Toe wrap hugs the feet without suffocating. Top wrap keeps foot against the sole. No heel slippage in sprint or climbing efforts. Plenty stiff and vented. Size 44 is consistent with Mavic, Shimano and Pearl. Because of the boa system it does seem it would accommodate wider or taller feet. The R3 has more room in the toe box than any of my other shoes. Speedplay Zero fit perfectly. This is now my favorite shoe.
customer_reviews.author: M. Chai

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to like
customer_reviews.text: I like nothing about these shoes. They are too wide in the heel cup and too narrow in the toes. the closure system pinches the top of your foot. They seem to be made of cheap plastic, not what you would expect for $200+ cycling shoes. The sizing is not true to to size, I am a 44yo cylist and have multiple brands ie specialized, shimano, DMT, pearl izumi shoes and all in sze 43 fit perfect. There are not available in that size the closest size for a US mens size 10 on the fizik web site fit chart says 43.5. these shoes are way too big. don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Belyna

customer_reviews.title: Quality is questionable
customer_reviews.text: I loved these shoes - LOVED them - trained and raced two 70.3 in them... and then the toe box started to collapse and now I can't wear them as they cut into the tops of my toes. You can feel a "wave" in the top of the toe box that just shouldn't be there. Aesthetically from the outside they still look fabulous, but internally they are not holding up. It is very bizarre and I haven't had this happen to any other pair of bike shoes in over 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Stepanek

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shoes but confusing sizeing
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes but I don’t understand the sizing. I purchase a pair of white R3s last year at the same listed size. The white ones are so tight that I can’t wear socks and these are on the bigger side, I have to wear socks and they are still big. Fortunately the boa system is so darn good that I don’t mind, I just wished I knew how the sizing worked. No telling what I might end up with next time.
customer_reviews.author: mmerg

customer_reviews.title: Good looks, high quality and great fit!
customer_reviews.text: Fit was really good right out the box. Materials and closure system seems high quality and SPD Shimano chest was easily installed and adjusted. The white color easily stains(hence, 4 stars). I have a slightly wider foot and normally wear a 10 D so I got the 43.5 as suggested and fits perfectly. The dual boa system allows for a custom fit and is easily adjusted while riding - upgraded from a 10 year old strap system - very happy with these. (5’9”, 160, ride ~80-100 mi per week)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive shoes, but you get carbon bottom and stylish shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am size 10.5 and the size 44 fits me well. The shores is very stylish in my eyes. The "Matt" leather surface make this pair of shoes looks "expensive" and cool. The Boa system is great! But I hope that they can include a paper right when you open the box how to use the boa system, that would be great! Cuz it took me about 10 minutes to figure out how to tighten (press down and turn) and loosen up (just pull up) then take off the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: CIvilGuy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: Previous Shoe: Louis Garneau's LS100 Comfort: These shoes were really comfortable compared to my Garneau's. I used to get numbness in my toes, but not at all with these. I did start to feel some shin discomfort around mile 20, but it went away quickly. I could just need to adjust my position on the bike, but time will tell. Power Transfer: Rode with Garneau's last week on same ride. I gained +1 mph with these for average speed on a 30 mile ride. Style: I wish a little less red on the upper, but good overall. B+
customer_reviews.author: B. Craig

customer_reviews.title: Sexy shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes feel great and look even better. I've been looking for new road shoes that were light, stiff, comfy and red/black to match my bike. These ticked off every box. Though I have only had them a short time, they seem exceptionally well made. I didn't think they would be affordable, but Amazon came through there too.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kaylie

customer_reviews.title: Best Road Shoes I Have Owned
customer_reviews.text: I have burnt through Giro, Specialized, Bontrager, LG and other Fizik shoes in my time riding, but none have been as comfortable and so easy to slip on, lock up and ride. I am not much of a fan of the locking technology (always feel its not as secure as it should be), but the fact remains that it does work well enough to remain snug and comfortable. In all honesty, it may also have to do with my own personal taste, as I think it just looks awesome too.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Wide feet beware!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I had to return these, because they are meant for narrow feet! Length wise they were good, but the widest portion was not made for wide feet. Its a shame because I was anticipating using these, after reading the reviews! The boa closure is top notch! This is in no way a knock against the company, I'll have to look into Sidi's or something.
customer_reviews.author: Pythagoras

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Good Fit
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box the shoes looked much narrower than my Sidi shoes. Very surprised that they felt roomier. I've used the Boa tightening mechanism on MTB shoes so even though they look flimsy, they work. The shoes are lighter, narrower, and more aero-looking than my Sidis. Innovative design for a cycling shoe. This is a moving bike part so lightness counts.
customer_reviews.author: Deekay11

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: This shoes are super comfy and I love the boa closures. The only thing i do not like it that the leather is so delicate it scuffs so easily. I have bought gore-tex patches over the toes to prevent any more scuffing.
customer_reviews.author: AmyB

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love Fizik shoes. They have been my favorite riding shoes for a while! The fit is impeccable and they last forever. I usually get numb feet on long rides but with these I do not. They are pricey though but I feel that they are worth the price for as long as they last.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, well made, and reasonably priced road cycling shoes
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes; fit like a glove from first use. Very comfortable on medium distance rides (usually 20-28 mi./day) w/o hotspots or pressure points. Fit was right on per the sizing chart. Stiff CF soles and BOA closures are terrific (can adjust easily on the fly). Would buy these again w/o hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cycling shoes, can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing fit. the closest to lace up cycling shoes that I've found so far. Depending on your foot you might want an insert but overall I find the fit and quality great. Careful to look at their sizing, in these I'm a 44.5 and normally wear a 45 Giro. Very happy with the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Holmes

customer_reviews.title: my ankles are rubbing against shoe...never had this with ANY shoe before, bad overall
customer_reviews.text: The twist on and off is great. Shoe is harder than other styles own/too flat. Not able to notice how bad the shoe hits my ankles until actually using...would DEFINITELY NOT recommend this style as I have never had this experience before and price point is a big loss.
customer_reviews.author: justshopping

customer_reviews.title: A little tight for that fat toed rider
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality shoe but cramped toe area. I use a 45 and found size to be consistent with Shimanos and shoe is wide. Front of shoes is pretty low profile making for slightly cramped toe area.
customer_reviews.author: Primalurges

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Lightweight, and Good Looking
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are super comfortable. I have about 100 miles in them now and I've never had a more comfortable pair of shoes. Considering the price, I think these Fizik R3's offer a huge amount of value. The Boa closure is easy to adjust and allows you to get a perfect fit for your foot. They clean up really nicely after riding in the rain, just a little water and paper towel got them looking like new. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love..... but... it’s an ankle biter.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is well built and very stiff. The closure is secure and the shoe is comfortable overall, if, you don’t bend your foot. The strap that wraps the front of your ankle cuts in, making it unusable for me. My wife tried them on with the same result. That’s the only reason I returned. Your experience may differ. This would be a 5 star shoe if it weren’t for the ankle strap.
customer_reviews.author: Jettaguy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Fizik!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely light and comfortable, yet stiff. Love the two way Boa dial. Every bit as good as the R1 Infinito except on price.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe on the market at this price point!
customer_reviews.text: Best shoes I have ever had, and I saved $100 buying on Amazon! Very happy with the fit and feel.
customer_reviews.author: Running love

customer_reviews.title: Just not for me
customer_reviews.text: Shoe feels good on the foot looks even better. Tongue cut into my ankle terribly making them unusable and didn’t even try riding them. I’ve seen the same complaint from a few others. Don’t want to say it’s a bad shoe because it might work for you just not me.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Fizik does it again.  Quality product that fits and rides well
customer_reviews.text: Love these R3 ARIA shoes. Already have several rides in them and like the boa tightening system. They are light and look very nice So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: BadgerDan

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow shoe with inadequate lace length
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say anything about the quality or function of this shoe. It is very narrow and the laces so short that I could not insert my thinly socked medium width foot. Not a good choice for all but narrow feet.
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Accidentally bought mine a size too big but it worked out because they run a tad narrow and after the "break in" they are very comfortable and so easy to adjust on the fly.
customer_reviews.author: David P

customer_reviews.title: BOA dial Broken, Vendor did not respond claim
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are nice and seemed to be good quality but one of the BOA dials broke after one month an the vendor did not do anything, not even answered an email when the claim was raised.
customer_reviews.author: Martin C

customer_reviews.title: Stiff and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: You cannot go wrong with a fizik cycling shoe. This is stiff when pedaling but also comfortable. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Xtrm09

customer_reviews.title: No original packaging
customer_reviews.text: the shoes arrived on time, yet came in nothing more than a plastic bag. No original manufacturers packaging. No shoe box. I was expecting brand new, in the box shoes. That is not what I received. The shoes themselves fit well, and are very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Tyrone Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! Easy to get in and out of. Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The right fit
customer_reviews.text: I been tiding for 12 years and been tru a bunch of cycling shoes , I regret not having these shoes before is the right fit and stiffness on the sole with easy adjustable laces.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Ocampo

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, not terribly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking shoe and fits well. Kind of hard interior. Overall a very nice shoe, but I wish it were a bit more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: STE

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe, tight fit
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, just too narrow a fit for my foot. Too narrow a spread for the ball of my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Louisa Slade

customer_reviews.title: This is a really good shoe. Very Stiff
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good shoe. Very Stiff. Comfortable to walk in. Boa system is great. I got the correct size and found it fit well.
customer_reviews.author: David Hartz

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazingly comfortable and provide stiff power transfer to the pedals. I have owned Sidi’s for years and these are far and away a better shoe for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Adamski

customer_reviews.title: Best riding shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable riding shoes I’ve ever worn! And the most stylish!
customer_reviews.author: Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the price, I think it's really cheap if the shoe is good. I received it after some days, the sole is stained with dirt, but the vamp is good. It fit my foot. The sole is really head and I can ride more easier.
customer_reviews.author: blueair2006

customer_reviews.title: Excelent road shoes
customer_reviews.text: High quality product. Materials in shoes are great. Durable and good stylish riding shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Eduar

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Really like these shoes very stiff, comfortable, nice ventilation, look great! Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Wolford

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes. Fit perfect per the guidelines and recommended chart.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W Heaser

customer_reviews.title: great deal on cycling shoes
customer_reviews.text: Took a couple of rides to break in, but now fit like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is comfortable and stiff so that it transfers energy well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T.

product_meta.title: Fizik Aria R3 Cycling Shoe
product_meta.description: The aria R3 will fit any road-rider's foot thanks to the enhanced volume control which uses two micro-adjustable boa ip1-b dials running strong, light steel-coated nylon Laces and lightweight plastic lace guides. Like all FIZZI: k's performance road shoes, the aria R3 is the result of our program of designing with, and for, leading professional racing cyclists to create the best possible shoes for you.
feature_bullets: With excellent adaptable fit, proven comfort, great looks and highly efficient power transfer, the aria R3 delivers premium performance
Ultimate fit thanks to the enhanced volume control which uses two micro-adjustable BOA ip1-b dials
The pliable yet protective Microtel upper fits around the foot with no seam-rub or pressure points
Unit direction full carbon outsole is lightweight and laterally stiff for ultimate power transfer
Advanced ventilation system for rider comfort and peak performance whatever your ride
